10416<a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_68">

10417Treatment of Stage I Prostate Cancer</a>

10418</li>

10419<li>

10420<a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_69">

10421Treatment of Stage II Prostate Cancer</a>

10422</li>

10423</ul>

10424</div>

10425</li>

10426</ul>

10427</div>

10428</div>

10429

10430 </section>

10431

10432

10433

10434 <section id="_84">

10435

10436 <h2>

10437Changes to This Summary (02/13/2023)</h2>

10438

10439 <div id="_section_84" class="pdq-sections">

10440<p id="_939" tabindex="-1">

10441The PDQ cancer information summaries are reviewed regularly and updated as new information becomes available. This section describes the latest changes made to this summary as of the date above.</p>

10442<p id="_3250" tabindex="-1">

10443<strong>

10444<a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_1">

10445General Information About Prostate Cancer</a>

10446</strong>

10447</p>

10448<p id="_3251" tabindex="-1">

10449Updated <a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_1676">

10450statistics</a>

10451 with estimated new cases and deaths for 2023 (cited American Cancer Society as reference 2). </p>

10452<p id="_3245" tabindex="-1">

10453<strong>

10454<a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_58">

10455Stage Information for Prostate Cancer</a>

10456</strong>

10457</p>

10458<p id="_3246" tabindex="-1">

10459Revised the <a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_1452">

10460list</a>

10461 of tests used to determine prostate cancer stage to include positron emission tomography and technetium Tc 99m-methylene diphosphate bone scan.</p>

10462<p id="_3247" tabindex="-1">

10463Added <a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_3214">

10464Positron emission tomography (PET)</a>

10465 as a new subsection.</p>

10466<p id="_3248" tabindex="-1">

10467Added <a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_3226">

10468Technetium Tc 99m-methylene diphosphonate (MDP) bone scan</a>

10469 as a new subsection.</p>

10470<p id="_disclaimerHP_3" tabindex="-1">

10471This summary is written and maintained by the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq/editorial-boards/adult-treatment" title="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq/editorial-boards/adult-treatment">

10472PDQ Adult Treatment Editorial Board</a>

10473, which is

10474editorially independent of NCI. The summary reflects an independent review of

10475the literature and does not represent a policy statement of NCI or NIH. More

10476information about summary policies and the role of the PDQ Editorial Boards in

10477maintaining the PDQ summaries can be found on the <a href="/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq#_AboutThis_1">

10478About This PDQ Summary</a>

10479 and <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq" title="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq">

10480PDQ&#174; Cancer Information for Health Professionals</a>

10481 pages.

10482</p>

10483</div>

10484

10485 </section>

10486

10487

10488

10489 <section id="_AboutThis_1">

10490

10491 <h2>

10492About This PDQ Summary</h2>

10493

10494 <div id="_section_AboutThis_1" class="pdq-sections">

10495<section id="_AboutThis_2">

10496<h3 id="_AboutThis_2_toc">

10497Purpose of This Summary</h3>

10498<p id="_AboutThis_3" tabindex="-1">

10499This PDQ cancer information summary for health professionals provides comprehensive, peer-reviewed, evidence-based information about the treatment of prostate cancer. It is intended as a resource to inform and assist clinicians in the care of their patients. It does not provide formal guidelines or recommendations for making health care decisions.</p>

10500</section>

10501<section id="_AboutThis_4">

10502<h3 id="_AboutThis_4_toc">

10503Reviewers and Updates</h3>

10504<p id="_AboutThis_5" tabindex="-1">

10505This summary is reviewed regularly and updated as necessary by the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq/editorial-boards/adult-treatment" title="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq/editorial-boards/adult-treatment">

10506PDQ Adult Treatment Editorial Board</a>

10507, which is editorially independent of the National Cancer Institute (NCI). The summary reflects an independent review of the literature and does not represent a policy statement of NCI or the National Institutes of Health (NIH).</p>

10508<p id="_AboutThis_22" tabindex="-1">

10509 Board members review recently published articles each month to determine whether an article should:</p>

10510<div class="pdq-content-list">

10511<ul id="_AboutThis_6">

10512<li>

10513be discussed at a meeting,</li>

10514<li>

10515be cited with text, or</li>

10516<li>

10517replace or update an existing article that is already cited.</li>

10518</ul>

10519</div>

10520<p id="_AboutThis_7" tabindex="-1">

10521Changes to the summaries are made through a consensus process in which Board members evaluate the strength of the evidence in the published articles and determine how the article should be included in the summary.</p>

10522<p id="" tabindex="-1">

10523The lead reviewer for Prostate Cancer Treatment is:</p>

10524<div class="pdq-content-list">

10525<ul id="">

10526<li>

10527Timothy Gilligan, MD (Cleveland Clinic Taussig Cancer Institute)</li>

10528</ul>

10529</div>

10530<p id="_AboutThis_9" tabindex="-1">

10531Any comments or questions about the summary content should be submitted to Cancer.gov through the NCI website's <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/email-us" title="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/email-us">

10532Email Us</a>

10533. Do not contact the individual Board Members with questions or comments about the summaries. Board members will not respond to individual inquiries.</p>

10534</section>

10535<section id="_AboutThis_10">

10536<h3 id="_AboutThis_10_toc">

10537Levels of Evidence</h3>

10538<p id="_AboutThis_11" tabindex="-1">

10539Some of the reference citations in this summary are accompanied by a level-of-evidence designation. These designations are intended to help readers assess the strength of the evidence supporting the use of specific interventions or approaches. The PDQ Adult Treatment Editorial Board uses a <a href="/publications/pdq/levels-evidence/treatment">

10540formal evidence ranking system</a>

10541 in developing its level-of-evidence designations.</p>

10542</section>

10543<section id="_AboutThis_12">

10544<h3 id="_AboutThis_12_toc">

10545Permission to Use This Summary</h3>

10546<p id="_AboutThis_13" tabindex="-1">

10547PDQ is a registered trademark. Although the content of PDQ documents can be used freely as text, it cannot be identified as an NCI PDQ cancer information summary unless it is presented in its entirety and is regularly updated. However, an author would be permitted to write a sentence such as &#8220;NCI&#8217;s PDQ cancer information summary about breast cancer prevention states the risks succinctly: [include excerpt from the summary].&#8221;</p>

10548<p id="_AboutThis_14" tabindex="-1">

10549The preferred citation for this PDQ summary is:</p>

10550<p id="_AboutThis_15" tabindex="-1">

10551PDQ&#174; Adult Treatment Editorial Board. PDQ Prostate Cancer Treatment. Bethesda, MD: National Cancer Institute. Updated &lt;MM/DD/YYYY&gt;. Available at: <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq" title="https://www.cancer.gov/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq">

10552https://www.cancer.gov/types/prostate/hp/prostate-treatment-pdq</a>

10553. Accessed &lt;MM/DD/YYYY&gt;. [PMID: 26389471]</p>

10554<p id="_AboutThis_16" tabindex="-1">

10555Images in this summary are used with permission of the author(s), artist, and/or publisher for use within the PDQ summaries only. Permission to use images outside the context of PDQ information must be obtained from the owner(s) and cannot be granted by the National Cancer Institute. Information about using the illustrations in this summary, along with many other cancer-related images, is available in <a href="https://visualsonline.cancer.gov/" title="https://visualsonline.cancer.gov/">

10556Visuals Online</a>

10557, a collection of over 2,000 scientific images.

10558

10559</p>

10560</section>

10561<section id="_AboutThis_17">

10562<h3 id="_AboutThis_17_toc">

10563Disclaimer</h3>

10564<p id="_AboutThis_18" tabindex="-1">

10565Based on the strength of the available evidence, treatment options may be described as either &#8220;standard&#8221; or &#8220;under clinical evaluation.&#8221; These classifications should not be used as a basis for insurance reimbursement determinations. More information on insurance coverage is available on Cancer.gov on the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/managing-care" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/managing-care">

10566Managing Cancer Care</a>

10567 page.</p>

10568</section>

10569<section id="_AboutThis_20">

10570<h3 id="_AboutThis_20_toc">

10571Contact Us</h3>

10572<p id="_AboutThis_21" tabindex="-1">

10573More information about contacting us or receiving help with the Cancer.gov website can be found on our <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/contact" title="https://www.cancer.gov/contact">

10574Contact Us for Help</a>

10575 page. Questions can also be submitted to Cancer.gov through the website&#8217;s <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/email-us" title="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/email-us">

10576Email Us</a>

10577.</p>

10578</section>
